qas.question: When did the Aryan culture begin its expansion?
Into what area did the Aryan culture expand?
What were the Aryan social classes called?
What did the Aryans label as impure in the indigenous peoples in order to exclude them from certain social classes?
What groupings formed up into larger monarchical groups?

context: At the end of the <a0_0>Rigvedic period<a0_0/>, the Aryan society began to expand from the northwestern region of the Indian subcontinent, into the <a1_0>western Ganges plain<a1_0/>. It became increasingly agricultural and was socially organised around the hierarchy of the four <a2_0>varnas<a2_0/>, or social classes. This social structure was characterized both by syncretising with the native cultures of northern India, but also eventually by the excluding of indigenous peoples by labelling their <a3_0>occupations<a3_0/> impure. During this period, many of the previous <a4_0>small tribal units<a4_0/> and chiefdoms began to coalesce into monarchical, state-level polities.
